channel.title: Conferences on Haiku Project
channel.description: Recent content in Conferences on Haiku Project

item.title: FOSDEM 2021
item.description: FOSDEM is a free and non-commercial event organised by the community for the community. The goal is to provide free and open source software developers and communities a place to meet to: get in touch with other developers and projects; be informed about the latest developments in the free software world; be informed about the latest developments in the open source world; attend interesting talks and presentations on various topics by project leaders and committers; to promote the development and benefits of free software and open source solutions.

item.title: Journées du Logiciel Libre (JDLL)
item.description: Free software booths, and a lot of talks for both the general public and developers. Also games for kids, and 3D printing and other demos by the local fablab. JDLL will be an in-person event if possible. Event Dates: 2021-04-03 - 2021-04-04 Event Homepage: http://www.jdll.org/ Activities: Haiku demo at the booth, handing out stickers and DVDs A talk by mmu_man Location Maison Pour Tous – salle des Rancy 249 rue Vendôme 69003 Lyon France

item.title: Journées du Logiciel Libre (JDLL)
item.description: Free software booths, and a lot of talks for both the general public and developers. Also games for kids, and 3D printing and other demos by the local fablab. Event Dates: 2020-04-04 - 2020-04-05 Event Homepage: http://www.jdll.org/ Activities: Haiku demo at the booth, handing out stickers and DVDs A talk by mmu_man Location Maison Pour Tous – salle des Rancy 249 rue Vendôme 69003 Lyon France

item.title: Capitole Du Libre 2019
item.description: (French-speaking event) Cet évènement autour du logiciel libre a lieu tous les ans fin novembre à l’INP-ENSEEIHT, il est gratuit et ouvert à toutes et à tous. Cette année il se déroulera les samedi 16 et dimanche 17 novembre. Organisé par l’association Toulibre, avec la participation active des clubs étudiants de l’N7 : TVn7, Net7 CAn7 et Photo7. Comme chaque année, les thèmes seront aussi bien orientés vers le grand public que vers les plus techniques.

item.description: The Alchimie is the event for alternative computing and digital creations Demo party Conferences Booths for non-profits and vendors Themes : digital creation retrogaming robotics Event Dates: 2019-11-01 - 2019-11-03 Event Homepage: http://triplea.fr/alchimie/ Activities: A talk by mmu_man Location Espace Rochegude, Quartier de la gare, 26600 Tain l’Hermitage France

item.title: FLISOL
item.description: Free software related talks and booths in all of latino america. Event Date: 2019-04-27 Event Homepage: http://flisol.info Activities: “Unconference” about Haiku Beta 1 (15:00, room 8) Location Flisol takes place simultaneously in multiple latino american coutries. Haiku will be on display at Medellin: FLISOL Medellin 2019 ITM Fraternidad Calle 54 A #30-01

item.title: BeGeistert 031
item.description: BeGeistert is the traditional meeting point for the international Haiku user and developer community. Read a few of the reports of previous BeGeistert meetings to learn more about the nature of the event. This time the event is organized by the guys of BeSly and is held in Hamburg, Germany. BeGeistert 031 will be a four-day event, the three nights including bed and breakfast and lunch, and the event itself is €164.

item.title: Alchimie 12
item.description: L’Alchimie, le salon de la récréation numérique : une démoparty, des conférences, des stands d’associations et de fabricants. Les thèmes abordés sont : la création numérique, le rétrogaming, la robotique. The Alchimie is the event for alternative computing and digital creations Demo party Conferences Booths for non-profits and vendors Themes : digital creation retrogaming robotics Event Dates: 2017-11-10 - 2017-11-12

item.title: KDC
item.description: Kernel Debugging Camp (KDC) is a newly formed coding sprint for Haiku developers to collaborate in person on improving the Haiku operating system. Haiku, Inc. and the HSA are donating KDC this year to help with facilities and student travel costs. Event Dates: 2017-11-19 - 2017-11-24 Event Homepage: http://pulkomandy.tk/kdc/ Event Contact: PulkoMandy <pulkomandy AT pulkomandy.tk> Location CIST Domaine d’ARIANE Impasse de Carpette 31700 Mondonville France

item.title: Google Code-In
item.description: Google Code-in is a contest to introduce pre-university students (ages 13-17) to open source software development. Since 2010, over 3200 students from 99 countries have completed work in the contest. Because Google Code-in is often the first experience many students have with open source, the contest is designed to make it easy for students to jump right in. Open source organizations chosen by Google provide a list of tasks for students to work on during the seven week contest period.

item.title: BeGeistert 030
item.description: BeGeistert is the traditional meeting point for the international Haiku user and developer community. The week after the BeGeistert weekend, a coding sprint will be held. All in the same location in Düsseldorf, Germany. Registration is now open at the BeGeistert.org website. The BG-weekend is 45 EUR including lunch. A night bed & breakfast in the youth hostel costs 33.40 EUR. Event Dates:  2016-10-29- 2016-11-04 Event Homepage:  http://begeistert.

item.title: RMLL / Libre Software Meeting
item.description: RMLL/LSM is a non-commercial cycle of conferences, round tables and workshops based on Libre Software and its uses. Its aim is to provide a platform for Libre Software users, developers and stakeholders as well as any visitor. You can also join many festive events such as the traditional Repas du Libre (Freedom Lunch), discovery tours of the Picardie region, some Free-access Culture shows and Nocturnes with the Free-access Digital Arts Festival.

item.title: Ohio Linuxfest 2015
item.description: The Ohio LinuxFest is a conference for the Free and Open Source software communities. Featuring talks by authoritative speakers, a large expo, tutorials, and more, the Ohio LinuxFest welcomes Free and Open Source Source professionals and enthusiasts of all ages and from all places to join us as we celebrate a free world with open source. Event Dates:  2015-10-02- 2015-10-03 Event Homepage:  http://ohiolinux.org/ Location Greater Columbus Convention Center 400 North High Street Columbus, OH 43125 United States See map: Google Maps Event Email:  team@ohiolinux.

item.title: Capitole Du Libre
item.description: The Capitole Du Libre takes place every year in Toulouse. The goal is to get people to discover free software and introduce various projects. There is a "village" with booths from various projects, conferences, workshops, and coding sprints for various projects such as LibreOffice and KDE. Event Dates:  2014-11-15- 2014-11-16 Event Homepage:  http://2014.capitoledulibre.org/ Location ENSEEIHT 2, rue Charles CAMICHEL Toulouse 31071 France Event Email:  contact@capitoledulibre.

item.title: DC-2011 - International Conference on Dublin Core and Metadata Applications
item.description: "Metadata is an increasingly central tool in the current web environment, enabling large-scale, distributed management of resources. Recent years has seen a growth in interaction between previously relatively isolated metadata communities, driven by the need for cross-domain collaboration and exchange. However, metadata standards have not been able to meet the needs of interoperability between independent standardization communities. For this reason the notion of metadata harmonization, defined as interoperability of combinations of metadata specifications, has arisen as a core issue for the future of web-based metadata.

item.title: RMLL/LSM
item.description: 2011 Libre Software Meeting is a free (as a beer and as a speech) and non commercial conference with talks, workshops and round tables about Free Software and its uses. The LSM goal is to provide a place for exchange between Free Software developers, users and stakeholders. LSM will be held this year in Strasbourg from 9th to 14th of July, 2011 by a set of local LUGs and organizations with the help of several public and private sponsors.

item.title: BeGeistert 024
item.description: BeGeistert is the traditional bi-annual meeting point for the international Haiku user and developer community. The week after the BeGeistert weekend, a coding sprint will be held. Maybe there'll also be another workshop for aspiring coders on Monday, which would be charged separately. All in the same location in Düsseldorf, Germany. Registration is now possible at the BeGeistert.org website. The BG-weekend is 35 EUR including lunch. A night bed & breakfast in the youth hostel costs about 25 EUR.

item.title: QEMU User Forum
item.description: QEMU as Open Source Software received wide acceptance by multiple research groups. The Workshop addresses all aspects QEMU for CPU and device emulation. It will provide QEMU users from industry and academia with a discussion forum to exchange ideas and to join forces. Event Dates:  2011-03-18 Event Homepage:  http://adt.cs.upb.de/quf/ Location Alpexpo Avenue d'Innsbruck Grenoble 38100 France Haiku Team Contact:  mmu_man Haiku Team Members:  François Revol Planned Activities:  Talk about "

item.title: SCaLE 9x
item.description: As mentioned on SCaLE's website: The premier Open Source conference in the U.S., now in its 9th year, will have content for everyone! If you're looking to learn, you can choose talks from the developer's track, the new sysadmin track, the beginner track, or the two general interest tracks. If you're interested in chatting with the exhibitors, you'll be able to to wander the Expo floor, with over 80 booths of open source folks eager to talk to you.

item.title: FOSDEM 2011
item.description: As mentioned on FOSDEM's about page, FOSDEM is a free and non-commercial event organized by the community for the community. The goal is to provide Free Software and Open Source developers and communities a place to meet to: get in touch with other developers and projects; be informed about the latest developments in the Free Software and Open Source world; attend interesting talks and presentations held in large conference rooms by Free Software and Open Source project leaders and committers on various topics; and to promote the development and the benefits of Free Software and Open Source solutions.

item.title: fOSSa 2010
item.description: goal of fOSSa (Free Open Source Academia Conference) is to reaffirm the underlying values of open source software: innovation & research in software development. The first edition aimed at providing valuable information about the open Source model at large (Benefits, Business Models, Legal Issues, Quality…), the second edition will focus on specific aspect we feel are key in a renovation of FOSS: Development, innovation & research, Community management & promotion, Public sector, Education.

item.title: LCA 2011
item.description: linux.conf.au (lca) is a conference about Open Source Software, including Linux. It brings together the world's community of Linux and open source enthusiasts who make considerable contributions to open source software. It is not limited to just Linux users - the community is much larger than this This is the second time lca has been held in Brisbane, with the first conference being hosted in Brisbane in 2002. 2011 will be a significant year for the open source community with many open source applications now considered mature and many more in development.

item.title: Fórum Internacional Software Livre (FISL 11)
item.description: This is the biggest open source event in south america and one of the biggest open source events in the entire world with more than 10,000 people attending. More banners and fliers Event map Event Dates:  2010-07-21- 2010-07-24 Event Homepage:  http://softwarelivre.org/fisl11?lang=en Location The Centro de Eventos da PUCRS Porto Alegre Brazil See map: Google Maps Haiku Team Contact:  bga Haiku Team Members:  BGA Planned Activities:  Bruno will be giving a presentation about Haiku on the 23rd and 24th.

item.title: Operating Systems Workshop at SBC 2010
item.description: The CSBC is the largest and most important event of the Brazilian Computer Society. Teachers, researchers, students and professionals in Brazil and abroad present and discuss topics related to the scientific, technological, educational and political in Computer Science in the country More than 5000 Computer Science students (bs, ms, phds) attending plus industry participation are expected. In 2010, everyone is invited to commemorate the thirtieth edition of the event to be held in Belo Horizonte, on the campus of the Eucharistic Heart Catholic University of Minas Gerais (PUC Minas).

item.description: Australian Haiku Users and Developers Conference Event Dates:  2010-08-22 Event Homepage:  http://haikudownunder.com/ Location Brisbane, Australia Brisbane Australia See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  Phil Greenway (Sikosis) Event Email:  admin@haikudownunder.com Haiku Team Contact:  Sikosis Haiku Team Members:  Sikosis Planned Activities:  See the site for more details.

item.title: SuperHappyDevHouse 37 (Palo Alto)
item.description: SuperHappyDevHouse is a non-exclusive event intended for creative and curious people interested in technology. We're about knowledge sharing, technology exploration, and ad-hoc collaboration. Come to have fun, build things, learn things, and meet new people. It's called hacker culture, and we're here to encourage it. Event Dates:  2010-04-10 Event Homepage:  http://superhappydevhouse.org/SuperHappyDevHouse37 Location Palantir Technologies Headquarters 151 University Ave Palo Alto 94301 United States See map: Google Maps Haiku Team Contact:  koki Haiku Team Members:  Andrew Bachmann, Scot McCreary, Jorge G.

item.title: EuroSys 2010
item.description: The EuroSys conference series brings together professionals from academia and industry. It has a strong focus on systems research and development: operating systems, data base systems, real-time systems and middleware for networked, distributed, parallel, or embedded computing systems. As a highly recognized conference - rank 11 out of 581 in terms of 2007 CiteSeer impact factor - EuroSys has become a premier forum for discussing various issues of systems software research and development, including implications related to hardware and applications.

item.title: OSC 2010 Kansai@Kyoto
item.description: OSC -- short for Open Source Conference -- is a series of events held in various cities of Japan designed to increase awareness about open source software through talks, exhibits and networking opportunities for both the open source communities and businesses. OSC 2010 Kansai@Kyoto, one of the several OSC events held in the Kansai area, takes places in the traditional city of Kyoto. Event Dates:  2010-07-09- 2010-07-10 Event Homepage:  http://www.

item.title: Chemnitzer Linux-Tage 2010
item.description: The Chemnitzer Linux-Tage are an event around the topic Linux and open source for everyone. This event is organised by IN Chemnitz, CLUG, university's computer centre, and its Faculty of Computer Science and many volunteers. Event Dates:  2010-03-13- 2010-03-14 Event Homepage:  http://chemnitzer.linux-tage.de/2010/info/ Location Universität Chemnitz Reichenhainer Straße 90 Chemnitz 09126 Germany See map: Google Maps Haiku Team Contact:  stippi Haiku Team Members:  Stephan Aßmus, Daniel Wünsch Planned Activities:  Haiku will have a booth at the exhibition area next to other open source operating systems like Fedora, Ubuntu, openSUSE, FreeBSD, NetBSD, etc.

item.title: BeGeistert 022
item.description: BeGeistert is the traditional bi-annual meeting point for the international Haiku user and developer community. After the weekend, a coding sprint will be held on the same location in Düsseldorf, Germany. Event Dates:  2010-04-10- 2010-04-11 Event Homepage:  http://www.begeistert.org/faq Location Youth Hostel Düsseldorf Düsseldorfer Straße 45 Düsseldorf 40545 Germany See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  BeGeistert Team Event Email:  info@begeistert.

item.title: FOSDEM 2010
item.description: The Free and Open source Software Developers' European Meeting (FOSDEM) is a two day event, organized by volunteers, to promote the widespread use of Free and Open Source software. Taking place in the beautiful city of Brussels, Belgium, FOSDEM meetings are recognized as "The best Free and Open Source events in Europe." Event Dates:  2010-02-06- 2010-02-07 Event Homepage:  http://www.fosdem.org/2010 Location ULB Campus Solbosh Avenue Franklin D.

item.title: fOSSa - Free Open Source Software Academia Conference
item.description: This conference aims at: fostering anyone who would like to create, sustain and transfer an OSS project from his laboratory to the industrial world in a more productive manner; helping start-ups and companies to find answers to overcome Open Source “constraints” within their environment and better understand the OSS culture; enabling academia and industrials to meet, talk together and find synergies between research projects and industrial needs; providing a free expression room where OSS Academic, Research and OSS Start-up's team can present their projects; showing the benefits of the participation in a collaborative network, with the purpose of increasing the value of academic results, gathering them in a common environment and releasing them in Open Source.

item.title: Florida Linux Show
item.description: This year (2009) the Florida Linux Show Orlando sponsored by Red Hat is an event where you can bring your family and enjoy a first or second vacation at the resort park of your choice. Visit warm, sunny Orlando, Florida for the Linux Show with the best weather and greatest entertainment and techno geek value on the planet on October 24th, 2009. Event Dates:  2009-10-24 Event Homepage:  http://www.

item.title: HUMBUG
item.description: HUMBUG is a Unix (for example, *BSD, Linux, Mac OS X, Solaris, etc.) user group that meets fortnightly at the University of Queensland, Brisbane, Australia. Daniel Devine will be giving a talk on Haiku; basically an Introduction and Technical overview. This talk will be recorded and made available on the web. Event Dates:  2009-10-03 Event Homepage:  http://humbug.org.au/ Location The University of Queensland Staff House Road St Lucia 4072 Australia See map: Google Maps Haiku Team Contact:  Sikosis Planned Activities:  Talks and presentations will take place between 6pm and 7pm on the night.

item.title: Alchimie 2k9
item.description: The Alchimie is the event for alternative computing Demo party Conferences Booths for associations and vendors Themes : digital creation sustainable development robotics Event Dates:  2009-11-06- 2009-11-08 Event Homepage:  http://triplea.fr/alchimie/ Location Espace Rochegude Tain l'Hermitage 26600 France Event Contact:  TripleA Event Email:  alchimie2k9@NOSPAMtriplea.fr Haiku Team Contact:  mmu_man Haiku Team Members:  mmu_man Planned Activities:  Haiku demo conference about R1/alpha features

item.title: SCaLE 8x Los Angeles
item.description: SCaLE is the Southern California Linux Expo, a renowned and very popular open source event that gathers open source communities, academic institutions and commercial exhibitors started in 2002. This event is supported by the presence of numerous open source projects, and is sponsored by prominent businesses such as IBM, Google and Dell. This is the fourth year in a row that Haiku has a presence SCaLE. Event Dates:  2010-02-19- 2010-02-21 Event Homepage:  http://www.

item.title: Ohio LinuxFest
item.description: The Ohio LinuxFest is a conference for the Free and Open Source software communities. Featuring talks by authoritative speakers, a large expo, tutorials, and more, the Ohio LinuxFest welcomes Free and Open Source Source professionals and enthusiasts of all ages and from all places to join us as we celebrate 40 years of unix. Event Dates:  2009-09-25- 2009-09-27 Event Homepage:  http://ohiolinux.org Locations Greater Columbus Convention Center 400 North High Street Columbus 43215 United States See map: Google Maps Greater Columbus Convention Center 400 North High Street Columbus, OH 43215 United States See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  Ohio LinuxFest Team Event Email:  team@ohiolinux.

item.title: Haiku Down Under 2009
item.description: Australian Haiku Users and Developers Virtual Conference When: Sunday 23rd August, 2009 - 9AM (GMT +10) Where: Virtual and Live at UQ Text Chat: via IRC and Video: via UStream Event Dates:  2009-08-23 Event Homepage:  http://haikudownunder.com/ Location The University of Queensland Staff House Road GP South Building 78 Brisbane, QLD 4702 Australia See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  Phil Greenway Event Email:  sikosis@haiku-os.

item.title: OpenSource World 2009 (San Francisco)
item.description: OpenSource World focuses on innovative solutions in real-world environments using open source, open standards and open architecture as part of an integrated IT infrastructure. The OpenSource World conference will present the latest Linux and open source ideas in a technical context by industry experts and innovators, giving IT end-users actionable initiatives that bring cost savings to the enterprise. Topics include Deployment and Management, Enterprise Application Infrastructure, Mobile, Security, Desktops and Netbooks, and Systems Troubleshooting.

item.title: 10th Libre Software Meeting / Rencontres Mondiales du Logiciel Libre
item.description: Like each year, conferences, round tables, and workshops will be proposed to the visitors during 5 days. Therefore experts, beginners, professionnals or just curious people will be able to find the interlocutors who will answer their questions among the various addressed themes. Moreover there is the associative village where anyone could have a walk. Event Dates:  2009-07-07- 2009-07-11 Event Homepage:  http://2009.rmll.info/ Location Polytech’Nantes - Site La Chantrerie rue Christian Pauc Nantes 44306 France Event Contact:  RMLL orgs Event Email:  contact@rmll.

item.title: BeGeistert 021
item.description: BeGeistert is the traditional bi-annual meeting point for the international Haiku user and developer community. After the weekend, a coding sprint will be held on the same location in Düsseldorf, Germany. Event Dates:  2009-10-17- 2009-10-18 Event Homepage:  http://www.begeistert.org/faq Location Youth Hostel Düsseldorf Düsseldorfer Straße 45 Düsseldorf 40545 Germany See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  BeGeistert Team Event Email:  info@begeistert.

item.title: SuperHappyDevHouse 32 (Oakland, CA)
item.description: SuperHappyDevHouse has become the Bay Area's premier monthly hackathon event that combines serious and not-so-serious productivity with a fun and exciting party atmosphere. Come to the DevHouse to have fun and get things done! Event Dates:  2009-04-25 Event Homepage:  http://superhappydevhouse.org/SuperHappyDevHouse32 Location Oakland, CA 1281 30th Street Oakland, CA 94608 United States See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  The DevHouse Crew Event Email:  devhouse@fluffypenguin.

item.title: FLISoL 2009 Medellín (Colombia)
item.description: El Festival Latinoamericano de Instalación de Software Libre (FLISoL) es el evento de difusión de Software Libre más grande en Latinoamérica. Se realiza desde el año 2005 y su principal objetivo es promover el uso del software libre, dando a conocer al público en general su filosofía, alcances, avances y desarrollo. FLISoL, short for "Festival Latinoamericano de Instalación de Software Libre," which means "Latin American Free Software Installation Festival," is the biggest open source event in Latin America.

item.title: OSCON 2009 (San Jose, CA)
item.description: The O'Reilly Open Source Convention, known as OSCON for short, is an annual convention for the discussion of free and open source software. Organized by O'Reilly Media and held each summer in the United States, OSCON also co-hosts other notable events, such as the Perl, PHP and Python conferences. This year is Haiku's debut at this conference. Event Dates:  2009-07-22- 2009-07-23 Event Homepage:  http://en.

item.title: BeGeistert 020
item.description: The bi-annual Haiku event in Düsseldorf. After the weekend, a coding sprint will be held on the same location. Event Dates:  2009-04-04- 2009-04-05 Event Homepage:  http://www.begeistert.org/faq Location Youth Hostel Düsseldorf Düsseldorfer Straße 45 Düsseldorf 40545 Germany See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  BeGeistert Team Event Email:  info@begeistert.org Haiku Team Contact:  stippi Planned Activities:  The weekend is a meeting point for the Haiku user and developer community.

item.title: SuperHappyDevHouse 31 (Cupertino, CA)
item.description: SuperHappyDevHouse has become the Bay Area's premier monthly hackathon event that combines serious and not-so-serious productivity with a fun and exciting party atmosphere. Come to the DevHouse to have fun and get things done! Event Dates:  2009-03-14 Event Homepage:  http://superhappydevhouse.org/SuperHappyDevHouse31 Location Rainbow Mansio 21677 Rainbow Drive Cupertino 95014 United States See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  The DevHouse Crew Event Email:  devhouse@fluffypenguin.

item.title: Haiku Coding Event
item.description: This is a coding event spontaneously organized as a prelude to BeGeistert 018 to give Haiku development a last minute kick before the demonstrations during BeGeistert. Event Dates:  2008-01-08- 2008-01-11 Event Homepage:  http://haiku-os.org/news/2007-12-03/begeistert_018 Location Youth Hostel Düsseldorf Düsseldorfer Straße 1 Düsseldorf 40545 Germany See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  stippi Event Email:  superstippi@gmx.

item.title: BeGeistert 018
item.description: BeGeistert is an international forum for users, developers and usergroups all about the Be Operating System. In this, it's 18th edition, BeGeistert is going back to the recently renovated Youth Hostel Düsseldorf, the same place that has hosted this community event so many times in the past. Event Dates:  2008-01-12- 2008-01-13 Event Homepage:  http://begeistert.org/ Location Youth Hostel Düsseldorf Düsseldorfer Straße 1 Düsseldorf 40545 Germany See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  Begeistert Orga Team Event Email:  info@begeistert.

item.title: SCaLE 6x
item.description: SCaLE is an open source event that gathers open source communities, academic institutions and commercial exhibitors. Started in 2002, this expo is supported by the presence of numerous open source projects, and is sponsored by prominent businesses such as IBM, Google and Dell. Attendance has been growing over the years, and the trend is expected to continue on the rise in upcoming SCaLE 6x. Event Dates:  2008-02-09- 2008-02-10 Event Homepage:  http://www.

item.title: FOSDEM 2008
item.description: The eighth Free and Open source Software Developers' European Meeting (FOSDEM) is a two day event, organized by volunteers, to promote the widespread use of Free and Open Source software. Taking place in the beautiful city of Brussels, Belgium, FOSDEM meetings are recognized as "The best Free and Open Source events in Europe." Event Dates:  2008-02-23- 2008-02-24 Event Homepage:  http://www.fosdem.org/2008/ Location Université Libre de Bruxelles (ULB), Campus du Solbosch Avenue Franklin D.

item.title: Chemnitzer Linux-Tage 2008
item.description: This is an event focused on free software that is held every year in the new lecture hall and seminar building of the Technical University of Chemnitz. The event consists of presentations, project stands, workshops, instalfests and a technology area. It is organized mainly by (former) students and employees of the Technical University of Chemnitz, with the cooperation of the Chemnitzer Linux User Group. Event Dates:  2008-03-01- 2008-03-02 Event Homepage:  http://chemnitzer.

item.title: LugRadio Live USA 2008
item.description: LugRadio Live USA 2008 brings to San Francisco the unique atmosphere of LugRadio Live UK, an event that has developed a strong reputation for providing a range of topics about free software, Open Source, digital rights, technology and more, a compelling list of speakers, exhibitors and birds of a feather sessions, and wrapping it all in a unique, fun, loose, social and inclusive event, which is often described as combining the atmosphere of a rock concert and a computer conference.

item.title: Live eTIC Party Université Montpellier 2008
item.description: Exchange of knowledge and experience on the use of new technologies in education fields. Linux and other alternative OSes. Demos of Linux distributions, conferences (OpenOffice for education, virtualization, ...). Event Dates:  2008-04-28- 2008-04-30 Event Homepage:  http://linux-live-usb.org/ip/index.php Location Maison des Étudiants Aimé Schoenig, Université de Montpellier Rue Vendémiaire Montpellier 29555 France Event Contact:  Jean-Louis MONINO Event Email:  jean-louis.

item.title: 9th RMLL/LSM (Libre Software Meeting)
item.description: The LSM (Libre Software Meeting) are an opportunity for all sort of public to come together around the free software. Over 5 days, conferences and workshops welcome everyone. This event is organized each year and for the 9th edition is hosted in the town of Mont de Marsan, from 1 to 5 July 2008. Event Dates:  2008-07-01- 2008-07-05 Event Homepage:  http://2008.rmll.info/?lang=en Location Institut Universitaire de Technologie - Mont de Marsan 371, rue du ruisseau MONT DE MARSAN 40004 France Event Contact:  Orga team Event Email:  contact@rmll.

item.title: LinuxWorld Conference & Expo 2008
item.description: LinuxWorld Conference & Expo San Francisco is a large-scale event that focuses in Linux and open source in general, and brings together industry leaders shaping the future of new enterprise technology in the largest single gathering of business and technical leaders deploying Linux and open source solutions. Average yearly attendance is approximately 10,000 people. Event Dates:  2008-08-04- 2008-08-07 Event Homepage:  http://www.linuxworldexpo.com/ Location San Francisco Moscone Center 1800 Chestnut St.

item.title: BeGeistert 019
item.description: BeGeistert is an international forum for users, developers and usergroups all about the Be Operating System. Like so many times before, this 19th edition will take place in the recently renovated Youth Hostel Düsseldorf. Event Dates:  2008-10-11- 2008-10-12 Event Homepage:  http://begeistert.org/ Location Youth Hostel Düsseldorf Düsseldorfer Straße 1 Düsseldorf 40545 Germany See map: Google Maps Event Contact:  BeGeistert Orga Team Event Email:  info@begeistert.

item.title: Ohio LinuxFest 2008
item.description: Hosting authoritative speakers and a large expo, the Ohio LinuxFest welcomes Free and Open Source Software professionals, enthusiasts, and anyone who wants to take part in the event. The Ohio LinuxFest is a free, grassroots conference for the Linux/Open Source Software/Free Software community that started in 2003 as a large inter-LUG meeting and has grown steadily since. It is a place for the community to gather and share information about Linux and Open Source Software.

item.title: 10th Journées Du Logiciel Libre (JDLL)
item.description: [fr] - Deux jours de rencontres entre des acteurs du logiciel libre (entreprises, communautés, associations) et le public sur la région lyonnaise. Ces rencontres sont animées par des conférences et des stands. Thème cette année : "10 années de logiciel libre". [en] - Two-days meeting of all Free Software actors (companies, communities, associations) and the local public. The event will have conferences and booths for projects. This year's theme is "

item.title: WhyFLOSS Conference
item.description: The WhyFLOSS Conference aims to spread the word about open source technologies in the IT community in general. Event Dates:  2008-11-28- 2008-11-29 Event Homepage:  http://www.whyfloss.com/es/conference/laplata08/program/130 Location UTN FRLP Av.60 esq. 124 La Plata Argentina Haiku Team Contact:  bga Haiku Team Members:  Bruno Albuquerque Planned Activities:  There will be one Haiku lecture at this event.

item.title: Live eTIC Party
item.description: Exchange of knowledge and experience on the use of new technologies in education fields. Linux and other alternative OSes. Demos of Linux distributions, conferences. item.title: FOSDEM 2009
item.description: FOSDEM is a free and non-commercial event organized by the community for the community. The goal is to provide Free Software and Open Source developers and communities a place to meet to: get in touch with other developers and projects; be informed about the latest developments in the Free Software and Open Source world; attend interesting talks and presentations held in large conference rooms by Free Software and Open Source project leaders and committers on various topics; and

item.description: SCaLE is the Southern California Linux Expo, an open source event that gathers open source communities, academic institutions and commercial exhibitors started in 2002. This event is supported by the presence of numerous open source projects, and is sponsored by prominent businesses such as IBM, Google and Dell. This is the third year in a row that Haiku has a presence SCaLE. Event Dates:  2009-02-21- 2009-02-22 Event Homepage:  http://scale7x.

item.description: The Chemnitzer Linux-Tage are an event around the topic Linux and open source for everyone. This event is organised by IN Chemnitz, CLUG, university's computer centre, and its Faculty of Computer Science and many volunteers. item.title: Submit Conference
item.description: Are you organizing a Haiku-related event? Are you planning to represent Haiku by giving a talk or manning a booth at a conference? If so, then let us know! Use this form to submit the information about the event, and we will add it to the List of Conferences, Calendar of Conferences and Map of Conferences. For your reference, check out this entry to see the kind of information is being published for these events.
